Visited this location mid-February 2024. This place is right next to the angel's eye mountain valley, the road to here is beautiful and easy to go. Entrance fee is 30k/person, cars and motorbikes can move directly inside. Inside this area, I see that there are quite a lot of services: eating, drinking, resting, but I don't know whether they are still operating, because many places look quite rundown. There are many places to have fun and explore here: caves, streams, lakes,... but the most prominent is still Thang Hen Lake. The day I went, the lake was still quite full of water and had a turquoise color. In general, this place still needs to renovate and upgrade facilities while promoting tourism promotion in order to attract more tourists.

Phuong Nam Cultural Tourist Area, located in Long Hung A Commune, Lap Vo District, Dong Thap Province, is an attractive destination for exploring the culture and nature of the Mekong Delta. The site recreates the atmosphere of a traditional Southern Vietnamese village with remarkable architectural works, such as Nam Phuong Linh Tu Temple, Nam Phuong Roofed Bridge, and traditional old houses. Visitors can explore and take photos at scenic spots like the conical hat pathway, Bali-style gate, and the large lotus pond. The tourist area also offers cultural activities, folk games, and serves local Mekong Delta cuisine. Its peaceful environment and beautiful landscapes provide a relaxing and enjoyable experience for everyone. It is an ideal place to learn about and experience Southern Vietnamese culture while capturing memorable moments. Phuong Nam harmoniously combines nature, traditional architecture, and entertainment activities. Visitors can stroll, explore each area, and enjoy the green, refreshing space. It is truly a must-visit destination when coming to Dong Thap.

Famous for its giant lotus leaves and a 100-year-old tortoise, the pagoda offers a peaceful and solemn atmosphere. Visitors can admire the traditional architecture, explore the lotus garden, and enjoy the fresh airâ€”perfect for relaxation and photography.

The Sa Dec Rose Garden Tourist Area is a very attractive destination. The area covers more than 2.5 hectares with over 6,000 rose plants of various varieties. When in bloom, the entire garden becomes vibrant and eye-catching, creating a perfect space for photography. In addition to roses, the site features many decorative miniatures for visitors to explore. The environment is spacious and pleasant, ideal for a relaxing stroll. The entrance fee is reasonable, suitable for families, groups of friends, or couples. The staff are friendly and always ready to assist visitors. The tourist area offers an experience close to nature and the beauty of the roses. Visiting here leaves a very positive impression of Sa Dec.

Vinh Trang Pagoda in My Tho, Tien Giang stands out with its unique architecture, harmoniously blending Asian and European styles. The spacious, airy grounds are adorned with delicate decorations and numerous serene and elegant Buddha statues, creating a peaceful and reverent atmosphere. Strolling around the pagoda, visitors can admire the architectural beauty while enjoying a calm, relaxing environment amidst the bustling city. Itâ€™s an ideal destination for those who want to explore culture, spirituality, and capture beautiful photos.

The present pagoda is located on an area of about 400 m2. The three-door gate is solidly built, roofed with tiles. The main hall looks east. The faÃ§ade of the palace is built with modern materials, the two main columns are embossed with a gracefully curved dragon shape. The rest of the electricity is just "wooden poles, corrugated iron roof", no floors and simple structure. The whole roof of the pagoda is supported by 24 tree pillars. Each tree is clad in clay, covered with winding dragons and other decorative patterns.

The interior is not very spacious, and because it contains many things, it is cramped. Here there are over a thousand statues of Buddhas, Fairies, Saints, Gods... and spirit animals made by Mr. Ngo Kim Tong during 42 years (from 1928 to 1970) for worship and decoration [1]. All are made mainly from clay, mixed with incense powder (incense) and acacia to prevent cracking, and are meticulously painted with paint and varnish.

Clay Pagoda is not only famous for thousands of statues made of clay, pagoda pillars are also covered with clay, but also many people know by 4 pairs of tall candles (candles) cast in 1940. , there are three pairs that each tree is 2.6 m high, 1 m wide, and is molded with 200 kg of wax. The other pair are smaller, and each tree is molded with 100 kg of wax. A total of 1.4 tons of wax. To cast it, it must be pure wax, chopped, put in a liquid cooking pan, poured into a mold (rolled with corrugated iron). After a month, the candle cooled down before removing the mold and decorating. Currently, two small candles are still burning around the clock since Mr. Ngo Kim Tong's death (July 18, 1970)

The Perfume River is a river closely associated with the lives of all Hue people. The river is located next to major local landmarks such as the Imperial City, Linh Mu Pagoda, Van Thanh, Dong Ba Market, Hue National School, Provincial People's Committee, Central Hospital, Hue University, Pedagogical University, Conservatory, Western Street, museums, parks, hotels... In short, following the Perfume River, visitors will enjoy the life of Hue people, and can even establish the life of Hue people when walking on the streets. When talking about Hue, we talk about the Perfume River and Ngu Mountain, but the Perfume River is truly the cradle that nurtures the soul of Hue.
